hypothesis_content.title: High-Frequency VWAP Breakout Fade in Stress Regimes
hypothesis_content.statement: During STRESS or sharp BEAR regimes, a 15-minute candle closing more than 1.8% above the 12-hour Volume-Weighted Average Price (VWAP), on volume exceeding the 15-min average by 200%, will be followed by a reversion towards VWAP. A fade (short) entry at the close of that candle will be profitable as price mean-reverts to within 0.5% of VWAP within the next 4 hours.
hypothesis_content.rationale: In panicked or strongly bearish environments, liquidity is poor and rallies are often driven by short covering or trapped longs, not sustainable buying. A sharp, high-volume spike away from the core VWAP anchor represents an exhaustion move, creating a high-probability fade opportunity as market structure remains weak.
entry_conditions: Regime == STRESS or (Regime == BEAR and 24h return < -3%)

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price returns to within 0.5% of the 12H VWAP
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price makes a new 4-hour high above the entry candle's high

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: The price continues trending away from VWAP after the signal more than 40% of the time, or the average 4-hour return from such fade entries is positive (i.e., the breakout continues).
